subject: Horses
Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: The undefeated Zarkava is ready to take on the boys for the first time Sunday, with a chance to become the first filly in 15 years to win the Prix de l’Arc de Triomphe in Paris. Zarkava was impressive enough in winning the Prix Vermeille last month that it was decided she would get a chance to boost her record to 7 for 7 in Europe’s most prestigious race. The last filly to take the Arc was Urban Sea in 1993. Zarkava, a 3-year-old filly owned by the Aga Khan, is the favorite in a 16-horse field and drew the inside No. 1 post for the nearly one-and-a-half-mile race at Longchamp. The winner earns $3.2 million from a total purse of $5.5 million.
